title: Video Log: Navigating the Studio
summary: A complete video walkthrough recorded from the cab. Explaining the Google 14-day requirement, the testing pipeline, and a tour of the site.

title: From The Forge to The Ledger
summary: This entry demystifies the studio's development pipeline, breaking down the journey from raw idea to polished release.
content: It explains the distinct purpose of each sector: The Forge serves as a sandbox for experimental prototypes and community feedback, while The Rookery acts as a rigorous testing ground to meet Google's 14-day/20-tester requirement. The final stage, The Ledger, is identified as the marketplace for stable, finished applications. The article emphasizes that the studio is not a static portfolio, but a "digital foundry" where user participation directly shapes the software.

title: Log Entry: The Cargo Bay is Open
summary: Bridging the gap between digital code and physical freight. The Cargo Bay is now live at Andy's Dev Studio.
content:
I just got back from a heavy 500-mile shift, and while I’m definitely feeling the hours, I couldn't go to sleep without hitting 'publish' on a major update to the site. 

Up until now, my focus has been almost entirely on the code—building math engines like Factor Hunter. But as a trucker, I know that at the end of the day, someone has to move the physical freight. That’s why I’ve added The Cargo Bay to the main library. 

It is a dedicated space for physical goods. I’m starting small while I finalize the inventory, but the first prototype is already on the shelf: the Official Factor Hunter Tee. It features the 'Ink on Parchment' design, representing the blend of old-school number theory and modern high-performance code. 

I'm heading to bed now. Check out the new shop tab and let me know what you think.

title: The Siege of the Composite
summary: Brute force is dead. How we used Quadratic Reciprocity, Web Workers, and Algebraic forms to hunt factors in the browser.

title: Log ID 4.64: The Cartography of Integers
summary: Deploying the Lattice Explorer. Moving from brute force hunting to geometric mapping. Visualizing the 'Diamond' regions and modulus grids.

title: Log ID 4.63: The Peterbilt Studio
summary: Late night dispatch from the cab. A raw look at squashing a critical caching bug at 2 AM with the help of the AI Squire. The reality of the double shift.

title: Log ID 4.62: The Stillness of the Forge
summary: Brakes set in the North Country. After a heavy haul through the Nexus and the Foundry, the Forge is quiet. Reflected on the standstill and the architecture of the journey.

title: PROJECT: GNOMONICUS
summary: We have breached the integer limit. A visualizer for the infinite Gnomon lattice is now live in the Forge.

title: SYSTEM UPGRADE V4.61
summary: Stabilized the bookmark rail physics, expanded the Ledger's data capacity, and established deep-link project archives.

title: The General: Commanding the Poly-Algo Squad
summary: Brute force is a blunt instrument. To conquer 60-digit composites, we need a tactical squad. Introducing 'The General,' a multi-threaded factorization command center.

title: Forging Code on the Open Road
summary: Why a truck driver is using AI to build number theory tools. The philosophy behind the studio.

title: Newton's Dice
summary: Early tests of the 2D physics engine. Collision detection is stable, but the bounce damping needs tuning.
